laundromat.spacy¶

laundromat.spacy.list_merger¶

laundromat.spacy.list_merger.merger(doc)¶

Merges the RegEx entities and the NER entities. If conflicts arise the function will try to create the largest entity possible. Whether by merging the entities or choosing the larger of the two.

laundromat.spacy.matcher_list¶

class laundromat.spacy.matcher_list.ListMatcher¶

Bases: object

csv_list_matcher(nlp, path_list=None)¶

Reads csv-files for names and surnames and uses EntityRuler to match to a entity and return to be added to the model pipeline

Parameters

  • nlp – The Spacy model

  • path_list – a list of tuples with the path of the list and its attendant entity.

Accepts only single entity type lists. Lists must be a single column with the string “text” in the first cell. :return: The ruler containing the new pattern rules to be included in the pipeline

default_list_append(item)¶
get_data(file_name: str)¶

Takes the file path of the integrated data and returns the csv-file as a dataframe :param file_name: :return dataframe:

laundromat.spacy.regex_formatter¶

laundromat.spacy.regex_formatter.regex_formatter(entities: list = None)¶

Formats desired entities such that they can be fed to SpaCy.

Parameters

entities – A list of strings denoting which entities one wishes to include in the model.

laundromat.spacy.spacy_model¶

class laundromat.spacy.spacy_model.SpacyModel(model_path=None)¶

Bases: object

SpacyModel class

A class for managing a SpaCy nlp model with methods for the following:

  • adding custom RegEx

  • easy training and display of results

  • various metrics

add_list(new_list)¶
Parameters

new_list – new lists must be a tuple of a path and a tag.

add_patterns(entities: list = ['FNR', 'DTM', 'TLF', 'AMOUNT', 'CREDIT_CARD'], before_ner=False, lookup=False)¶

Adds desired patterns to the entity ruler of the SpaCy model.

Parameters

entities – a list of strings denoting which entities the nlp model should detect.

confusion_matrix(TEST_DATA, strict=True)¶

Calculates confusion matrix for given data. Only considers whether a token has been labeled and not if it has been labeled correctly.

Returns

Confusion matrix as a dataframe.

count(text: str)¶

Parameters

text – The text in question as a string.

Returns

A digraph of the linguistic dependencies in the text.

Disables the NER-model in the pipeline.

Enables the NER-model in the pipeline.

f1_scorer(TEST_DATA)¶

Ignores data of the wrong format. If this is a problem, use print_scores instead. :return: Scores as a dictionary.

Prints current NLP pipeline.

predict_list(text_list)¶
print_matcher_lists()¶
print_regex_labels()¶

Prints regex labels

print_scores(TEST_DATA, strict=True)¶

Prints the following scores: - Accuracy - Balanced accuracy - Precision - Recall - F1 score

replace(text: str, replacement='entity', replacement_char='~')¶

Replaces found entities in the given text with the attendant entity labels, e.g. a name is replaced with <PER>. Shuffle replacement is hard coded to use a list of girl, boy, county, country, and town names.

Parameters

  • text – The text in question as a string.

  • replacement – The kind of replacement desired. Default is entity.

  • replacement_char – The character used for character and padding replacement. Default is ~.

Returns

the modified text as a string

similarity(text: str, replacement='entity', replacement_char='~')¶
Parameters

  • text – The text in question as a string.

  • replacement – The kind of replacement desired. Default is entity.

  • replacement_char – The character used for character and padding replacement. Default is ~.

Returns

The cosine similarity between the unaltered text and the altered text.

top_n_nodes(text: str, n=10)¶
Parameters

  • text – The text in question as a string.

  • n – Number of nodes desired. Default is 10.

Returns

The top n nodes with highest degree in the dependency graph.

train(TRAIN_DATA, labels: list, n_iter: int = 30, output_dir=None)¶
Parameters

  • TRAIN_DATA – training data

  • labels – texts with labels

  • n_iter – number

  • output_dir – Where the model should be saved
